pullRequest.title: [BESU-1059] Fix "Pausing mining" log even though node is not a validator
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR description
Display Pausing mining while behind chain head log on a CLIQUE network only if the node is a validator
Test

Start on goerli from scratch (no issue and log not present)
Start on goerli with already synchronized database (no issue and log not present)
Start on local Clique network (if the node is a validator the log is present
otherwise no)
Start on ethhash mordor network without mining (no issue and log not present)
Start on on ethhash mordor network with mining (no issue and log present)

commit.message:
remove log on clique network if no validator

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM <karim.t2am@gmail.com>

Merge branch 'upstream/master' into feature/besu-1059-invalid-mining-log

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM <karim.t2am@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Nit: could we not use "mining"?  I always associate that with PoW mining and nonce solving.  Is there a more different term like "sealing" "block production" or "validating" we could use?
Mining is the correct term here for sure.

do we want to be careful here? The coinbase is not necessarily this node's ID (maybe in our code base, but the concepts are different) - it'd be nice to see this comparing nodeKey against validator list
nit: maybe isSigner? IBFT2 has validators, Clique has signers.
this shouldn't be exposed here - this class isn't a carriage for this - its used internally to determine if/how we can mine.
rather than exposing the ProtocolContext, we can add a function "isValidator" to the CliqueMiningTracker?
using getCoinbase() is kinda dangerous as it does not necessarily relate to the local node's ID.
nit: the haltMiningOperation will stop the current mining operation, which is sort of a side-effect - in the past I've avoided side-effects in conditions - not sure we care.

nit: changing this from private to protected opens the API significantly (and just for logging purposes) - is there a way we can move the conditional into the child-class, but keep the heavy-lifting here?
nit: could/should this stay in the base class? and just overriden in clique?

commit.message:
Merge branch 'upstream/master' into feature/besu-1059-invalid-mining-log

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM <karim.t2am@gmail.com>

fix review issues

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM <karim.t2am@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: nit: Other thing I was thinking - is this really an "info" level log - or can it be reduced to debug? Seems like something we wouldn't need to see all the time.
